Class ec.transform.coverage.Application 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.transform.coverage.Application
public abstract class Application
extends Object
This is the base class for an ecov tool. To use it, create a subclass with this main: 
 static public void main(String[] args)
 {
   (new ApplicationSubclass()).body(args);
 }
and override the parseOptions() and guts() methods.

scriptName
The scriptname is the name of the script that invoked 'java'.

Application()

body(String[])
The body of the application.
fatalError(String)
Report error message, then exit with status 1.
fatalUsageError(String)
Report usage error message and correct usage, then exit with status 1.
parseOptions(int, String[])
Handle all options that begin with '-'.
usage(String)
Report on usage of the application.

scriptName 
 protected String scriptName
The scriptname is the name of the script that invoked 'java'. It's typically like ecov-foo or ecov_foo. It's used to provide more helpful error messages that assume that what the user typed was something like:

ecov-foo logfile...

Application 
 public Application()

body 
 protected void body(String args[])
The body of the application. Processes the first argument, which all applications must have, calls parseOptions for '-' options, then calls handleArguments() for the remainder of the command line.

parseOptions 
 protected int parseOptions(int firstOption,
                            String args[])
Handle all options that begin with '-'. Returns the index of the first option that doesn't. The superclass version handles the case where there are no options.

Parameters:
firstOption - Where to start looking for options. (This is a reminder that, for these programs, the first argument is not an option.)
fatalUsageError 
 protected void fatalUsageError(String description)
Report usage error message and correct usage, then exit with status 1.

fatalError 
 protected void fatalError(String description)
Report error message, then exit with status 1.

usage 
 protected abstract void usage(String scriptName)
Report on usage of the application. The report should be in terms of what the user types. That is, it should be something like "ecov-report logfile...", not "java ec.e.Coverage...".

Parameters:
scriptName - the command the user thought she was executing.
